demographics.name: Linda Jones
demographics.supportServices: Nutrition and Smoking Cessation resources provided.

diagnosis.primary: Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) - Squamous Cell Carcinoma
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Persistent cough, shortness of breath on exertion, unintentional weight loss (10 lbs/2 mo).
pathologyFindings: EBUS biopsy of Station 7 (subcarinal) lymph node positive for Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
diagnosis.relevantHistory: 50 pack-year smoking history (currently smokes 0.5 ppd), Hypertension.

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with concurrent Chemotherapy
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing primary tumor and involved nodes (PTV_Primary+Nodes)
treatmentPlan.potentialConsolidationTherapy: Durvalumab (immunotherapy) after chemoradiation completion (Managed by Dr. Allen)
therapistAlerts: Patient is a current smoker; encourage cessation.
Assess for esophagitis and cough daily.
High risk for fatigue and myelosuppression from chemo.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in BodyFix vacuum bag with arms up on wingboard. Respiratory motion managed with 4D-CT. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals).
ctSimulation.ctNotes: 4D-CT acquired for VMAT planning. Fused with diagnostic PET/CT. ITV approach to be used for target delineation to account for motion.

dosimetry.planStatus: Final - Approved by Dr. Sarah Jenkins
dosimetry.constraints: Spinal Cord Max < 45 Gy; Heart V30 < 40%; Total Lung V20 < 30%
dosimetry.planNotes: VMAT for locally advanced lung, motion managed.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily CBCT for soft tissue alignment. Tolerances met.
fractions.sideEffects: No acute side effects after first fraction.
fractions.notes: Patient tolerated first treatment and concurrent chemotherapy well. Smoking cessation resources provided again.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily CBCT match. Shifts V:0.3, L:-0.1, L:0.2. Approved.
fractions.sideEffects: Grade 2 esophagitis, managing with medication. Cough persists.
fractions.notes: OTV today. Discussed chemo hold w/ Med Onc due to low counts. Continue RT.

imagingAndReports.summary: Squamous Cell Carcinoma identified in Station 7 lymph node sample.

reportDetails.specimen: Fine Needle Aspiration, Station 7 (Subcarinal Lymph Node)

labResults.notes: Week 2 - Nadir expected. Chemo held by Med Onc.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Sarah Jenkins (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ Stage IIIA NSCLC for concurrent ChemoRT. Reviewed case w/ Dr. Allen. Plan for VMAT to 60Gy/30fx to primary and involved nodes. Discussed RT toxicities (esophagitis, pneumonitis, fatigue). Pt agrees. 4D Sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Paul Allen (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient c/o fatigue. Labs today show Gr 2 neutropenia, Gr 1 thrombocytopenia. Hold chemotherapy this week. Plan for G-CSF support if counts do not recover. Continue RT. Recheck CBC next week.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Sarah Jenkins (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: RT ongoing. Pt reports moderate fatigue. Starting to develop sore throat (Grade 1 esophagitis), started Esomeprazole. Discussed chemo hold w/ Dr. Allen. Continue RT. Monitor symptoms.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Definitive (curative) treatment with concurrent chemoradiation followed by immunotherapy.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Fatigue (very common), esophagitis (difficulty/pain swallowing), pneumonitis (cough, shortness of breath), skin irritation/redness in treatment area, nausea/vomiting (chemo), hair loss (chemo), low blood counts (chemo).
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Reporting fever/chills, worsening SOB, chest pain, difficulty swallowing. Skin care instructions (mild soap, moisturizers). Importance of hydration and nutrition.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT/weekly chemo, weekly labs, report symptoms promptly. Smoking cessation strongly advised.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Importance of anti-nausea meds with chemo, use of Esomeprazole/cough syrup as needed.
